text: {| |} The Antoinette 8V was an early French eight-cylinder, liquid-cooled, V engine, the first series production gasoline-fueled, spark plug ignition engine of any kind produced with manifold injection. It was typically rated at 50 hp. First produced in 1906 it was used on a number of early French aircraft, including Alberto Santos Dumont's 14 Bis and the Antoinette company's own Antoinette VII. ==Specifications (Antoinette 8V)== Data for: Antoinette 8V ==See also== ==References== * https://web.archive.org/web/20120207170631/http://www.oldengine.org/members/diesel/Duxford/1910-3.htm * https://web.archive.org/web/20151227193011/http://wwiaviation.com/engines/Antoinette.html ==External links== * Old Machine Press page on Antoinette (Levavasseur) aircraft engines Category:1900s aircraft piston engines
title: Antoinette 8V
